intro: Pimpinella neglecta, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Native to the western United States, it thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gravelly soils. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family, with potential ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
